text:
They're no strangers to strutting their stuff on the red carpet.
And that's exactly what Hugh Jackman and his wife Deborra-Lee Furness did on Thursday night in LA, as they attended the G'Day USA gala event.
The Wolverine actor sported rugged facial hair, while wife Deb showed off her peachy pink locks pinned in a stylish up-do.
Scroll down for video
Black tie ready: Hugh Jackman and his wife Deborra-Lee Furness were among the stars to grace the red carpet at the G'Day USA Gala in Los Angeles on Thursday
Hugh looked dapper in a classic black suit and accessorised with a contrasting navy blue tie and polished black dress shoes.
The 47-year-old lovingly wrapped his arm around his wife of 20 years as they posed on the red carpet together.
Deb opted for an interesting outfit for the black tie event, wearing a black shift dress paired with sheer tights that finished below the knee.
Dressed to impress! Hugh looked dapper in a classic black suit and accessorised with a contrasting navy blue tie
Fancy seeing you here! Hugh and Deborra-Lee enjoyed a chat with Foreign Minister on the red carpet
Did he drop a hint? The 47-year-old posted a picture on Instagram a day before the gala of himself with a microphone in hand before thanking both Qantas and G'Day USA
Her black jacket was cropped short at the front, and featured a long train that skimmed the floor at the back.
She finished her look with a pair of open toed black wedges, and a pair of mismatched earrings.
The Australian actor, who will soon be back on screens in Eddie The Eagle, teased fans with an image he uploaded to Instagram on Wednesday, suggesting he was hosting the event.
Unusual: Deb opted for an interesting outfit for the black tie event, wearing a black shift dress paired with sheer tights that finished below the knee
Statement maker: Her black jacket was cropped short at the front, and featured a long train that skimmed the floor at the back
Hugh appears to be on a stage dressed casually with a microphone in hand and a light shining over his shoulder.
He captioned the post: 'Mic check' and went on to thank and tag both G'Day USA as well as sponsors Qantas.
However, the night was actually hosted by Muriel's wedding stars Toni Collette and Rachel Griffiths, which marked the 20th anniversary of the pair's iconic Australian film.
Held in Los Angeles, the night is designed to celebrate the best of Australian food, wine and entertainment, while promoting business relationships.
